function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"High population density and communal living may increase the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Role of cities in creating the climate crisis","category":"Vulnerability risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overcrowded apartments","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate privacy and accessibility in living spaces","category":"Physical activity and mobility","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate living space hindering physical distancing and well-being","category":"Physical activity and mobility","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of flexibility in co-housing or condominium areas hinders adaptation to increased need for space and social distancing","category":"Access to infrastructure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inequality in housing conditions","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unresolved past problems related to housing quality","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exclusion of articles based on language english only","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exclusion of study sites not located within urban or peri-urban areas","category":"Access to infrastructure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exclusion of articles with limited sampling points to green spaces","category":"Access to infrastructure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on wildlife health capacity in urban environments","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neglecting the environmental dimension and focusing solely on human health","category":"Vulnerability risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changing the focus of environment and animals as sources of diseases towards salutogenic approaches","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Non-domestic animals in urban areas impacting human and animal health","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for green space quality in study design","category":"Access to infrastructure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inability to assess individual factors due to lack of objective measurements","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited studies assessing multiple animal groups simultaneously","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Population density around green space affecting safety perception and wildlife richness","category":"Vulnerability risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Site-level factors and spatial configuration influencing restorativeness and wildlife support","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Design features such as water bodies, footpaths alignment, and habitat heterogeneity may impact human behavior and perception, potentially affecting the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Human aesthetic preferences in green spaces may negatively impact urban wildlife support, leading to a potential conflict between human preferences and wildlife habitat needs.","category":"Cultural and Lifestyle Risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Presence of dogs in green spaces can disrupt wildlife activity patterns, but walking dogs is a common motivation for people to visit green spaces.","category":"Cultural and Lifestyle Risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Positive impact of biological sounds and geophysical sounds on restoration, stress recovery, and tranquility perception","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential correlation between activities and perceived restorativeness and well-being","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of quality assessment of green areas in visual stimuli and students as participants may not fully represent the reality of user experience in green spaces or the characteristics of the whole population.","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Role of perceived safety in urban green spaces","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited access to nature in urban areas leading to reduced restoration and well-being","category":"Physical activity and mobility","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Disturbance, fragmentation, and isolation of urban green spaces
